_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Sunoco Pipeline, L.P. (Sunoco) - Independence Truck Load-Out located in Avella, Pennsylvania is a propane storage and pipeline delivery facility. The facility receives propane by tanker truck at one offloading location, stores the propane in one 30,000 gallon pressure vessel, and delivers propane into the Mariner East II pipeline (MEII). 



Two requirements of this section specifically apply to operations at the Independence Truck Load-Out:



1.  Purpose and General Duty Clause - The essence of the general duty clause is that an owner/operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has a fundamental obligation to ensure a safe operation and to have plans in place in the event of an accident to appropriately manage the situation. Sunoco is committed to ensuring the safe operation of the Independence Truck Load-Out, as well as all of its other operations, to ensure a safe workplace for employees and a safe location for neighbors in the community. Sunoco, therefore, has procedures in place to prevent accidents and is committed to emergency preparedness both for the facility and community-wide by coordinating with the Chartiers Township Volunteer Fire Department and the Washington County Department of Public Safety.



2.  Risk Management Plan - The primary function of the Independence Truck Load-Out is to act as an Liquefied petroleum gas storage facility.  Due to the flammable effects associated with propane, it is necessary to observe certain safety precautions to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to employee health, and to minimize the threat and impact to nearby members of the community.  Sunoco Pipeline, L.P. - Independence Truck Load-Out is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety and health.  Safety at the facility depends on the manner in which LPG is handled as well as the various safety devices incorporated into the design of the process.
